docs.text: magnolia left me relling from the theatre , staggering from the relentless assault of an adventurous director reveling in his craft .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at nearly three and a half hours , magnolia will strike some as a brute of a film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it not only demands your attention , but challenges you to grasp the significance of seemingly unrelated storylines and hidden intentions .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is delirious , depressing , heady , pretentious , surreal filmmaking .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's also a movie that will polarize its viewers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: director paul thomas anderson takes a talented cast , wraps them in a net of interrelated stories and sets them spinning in a symphony of despair whose song doesn't let up until an oddly exhilerating , biblically influenced pseudo-climax .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the character's make up a modern day gomorrah in the soulless way in which they live their lives .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is frank mackey ( tom cruise ) , a slithery snake charmer of men whose " search and destroy " seminars teach how to mentally rape a woman to get into her pants .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is earl partridge ( jason robards ) , a dying media tycoon yearning to make amends for a lfe of callousness by finding his estranged son .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is game show host jimmy gator ( phillip baker hall ) , a self absorbed tv icon who is hiding more than a few secrets from his public .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and there is police officer jim kurring ( john c . reilly ) , who cloaks himself in the codification of organized religion and the legal system , perhaps masking a man who needs rules to fuel his decision making process .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: given equal weight are stories involving a coke-addled emotional cripple ( melora walters ) , a former tv quiz show champion ( william h . macy ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a materialistic , adulterous wife ( julianne moore ) , a child ( jeremy blackman ) victimized by a mentally abusive parent , and a caring , empathetic nurse ( philip seymour hoffman ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hovering over all these characters is a cloud of death , lies and despair .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is not a pleasant movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is not one bad note in the acting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is affecting and layered and wonderful .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is a moment where tom cruise wordlessly implodes that rivals work he has done in whole films .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: then he tops himself with a mesmerizing deathbed scene .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: walters plays her character with red-eyed rawness and a fierce self-destructiveness that is anxiety inducing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: robards convincingly portrays a fading whisper of a man , who still hears a lion's roar when he speaks .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: director anderson has apparently given the actors lattitude to emote .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the problem is that he stays on them too long .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: julianne moore's character , linda , quickly escalates to a frenzied pitch of guilt , tears , screaming and remorse and never backs off from it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after a few hours , it turns from interesting to chinese water torture .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: quite a few scenes , such as the game show , go on just a bit too long and will be off-putting for those used to a pat 90 minute film where the main theme is reiterated several times just in case you missed it the first go around .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and just what is the theme ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: alienation ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hopelessness ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: anderson challenges you to draw your own conclusions and he doesn't make it easy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film starts by showing three , strange and seemingly unrelated events .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a harbinger of the synchronicity to come .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at times , different stories reach reach key moments at the same time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: other times , stories seem to veer off into uncharted territory , regardless of what else is happening .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: anderson is audacious enough to even have a group sing in the middle of the film !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what's surprising is that it mostly works .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if you have doubts about anderson's intentions , i'll ask you to pay attention to the final frame .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: despite all the sturm und drang , magnolia ultimately speaks to man's capacity for hope and attempts at redemption .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: despite magnolia's needlessly long running time and its propensity for uneven editing as anderson plays the auteur , showing off fro the masses , i have to admire his guts .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is truly adventurous filmmaking that spits in the face of conventional storytelling .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: my rating : a bulleye .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( stars )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a side note : helping anchor the film is a perfectly matched soundtrack featuring aimee mann .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: her lyrics often add depth to a scene thematically while the actual music is both morose and beautiful .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when she sings " save me " at the end , it enhances the yearning felt by the characters , just as " wise up " mirrors the anguish felt by all as they contemplate their lives .
docs.label: positive
